result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Wesley Lewis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles Wesley Lewis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Tedia K. Gamino appeared by video for Charles Wesley Lewis.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Case in court for competency hearing.  Parties in receipt of examiner's report. State does not challenge Dr. Collins report.  Defendant does challenge Dr. Collins report.  Court qualified Dr. Collins to testify as an expert in the field of psychology.   Sworn for the State:  Dr. Deborah Collins.  Sworn for defense: Charles Lewis.  Testimony closed.  Arguments heard. After review of all evidence, report and testimony of Dr. Collins Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame.  Order of Commitment signed and filed.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility. FORTHWITH. 
Court orders case adjourned  back to Branch 41 for Competency Review Hearing
Review hearing scheduled for January 27, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Charles Wesley Lewis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Tedia K. Gamino appeared by video for Charles Wesley Lewis.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Case in court for return on doctors report.  State does not dispute the findings, however the defense contests the report.   Case adjourned for contested doctors report hearing.
Competency hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; LEWIS REPORT

Defendant Charles Wesley Lewis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney David Thomas Conley appeared by video for Charles Wesley Lewis.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
